Subject: Clarifying SURT prefixes, SurtPrefixScope ?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The SurtPrefixScope in Heritrix is more efficient and flexible than the
DomainScope, HostScope, or PathScope options, but not as easy to use or
understand.

We've made some improvements to the documentation, specifically at:

SurtPrefixScope
  http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#surtprefixscope

SURT glossary entry
  http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#surt

SURT prefix glossary entry
  http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#surtprefix

If we could make this SURT prefix-based scopes better understood, we
would phase out the other more basic legacy scopes, or reimplement them
in terms of SurtPrefixScope. (Everything they do can also be achieved
more through SURT prefixes.)

SurtPrefixScope could become the default scope, instead of DomainScope,
as soon as the upcoming 1.4 release.

We'd like feedback...

  - Are SURT options understandable?

  - How could they be made easier to use/understand/configure?

- Gordon @ IA
